item.title: Tent in Warwick Avenue, 27th September
item.description:
Someone has put up a tent by the taxi rank.Immediate enforcement action is needed otherwise other tents will be put up. These obstruct the pavement. Alternative provision for homeless people is urgently needed now that the weather is becoming colder.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warwick Avenue, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive acorn & leaf debris, 27th September
item.description:
The large oak tree on the corner of Barnard Close & Poyntell Crescent causes a huge amount of fallen acorns & leaves. Even though your schedule states fortnightly sweep for street & monthly for road, this has not happened for months, it definitely did not occur on the last date 23 Sept. There is a residential care home nearby & they cannot move wheelchairs safely on pavement. The tree is a council tree. Listed number 47.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Poyntell Crescent, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree waste left, 27th September

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Highcombe, Charlton, London

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Obscured by Tree, 27th September
item.description:
The street lamp, outer circle - lower side of Oakleigh Crescent, N20 - is currently proving ineffective due to the fact that the tree, next to it, is blocking out significant light. It needs to have tree surgery, (branch pruning etc.), to correct this problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakleigh Crescent, Brunswick Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement closed, 27th September
item.description:
The pavement is blocked. To walk around it you have to go in the road. How can disabled people and elderly people do this? There is no drop down kerb or signs to say the pavement is closed. There needs to be reasonable adjustments made here. Further, there are bins left here with rubbish which block the pavement even more. It's all quite unsightly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ringers Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grazeley Close, Barnehurst, London
